pages.text: Some sort of halfway between a crystal and gold, cincinnasite is one of the more surprisingly pleasant materials I have found in the Nether.

Its beauty can't be understated; amidst the crumbling rock, stinking flesh, and scorching lava, it is rather nice to come across something so easy on the senses.$(br2)On closer inspection, it forms highly detailed and intricate patterns on its surface, such patterns making it a surprisingly tough material when compounded together.

Whoever built the cities in the seas of lava certainly figured that out already; the buildings are reinforced with cincinnasite pillars and supports, and the windows of quartz glass are framed with the material as well.$(br2)This will be a welcome fortification for my dwelling, and might even make it nicer to look at.
Of course being from the Nether, I can take advantage of its toughness and resilience to make a Cincinnasite Forge which can be used for faster smelting.
